item.description:
The very popular National Theatre Live series continues with Chekhov's The Cherry Orchard, starring Zoe Wanamaker. As always, these shows sell out, so it's strongly advised to get your ticket ($20) in advance. 

 

About the play:

Chekhov’s  The Cherry Orchard, directed by NT Associate Director Howard Davies, whose recent productions of Russian plays (including  Philistines, Burnt by the Sun and  The White Guard) have earned huge critical acclaim.

Ranyevskaya returns more or less bankrupt after ten years abroad. Luxuriating in her fading moneyed world and regardless of the increasingly hostile forces outside, she and her brother snub the lucrative scheme of Lopakhin, a peasant turned entrepreneur, to save the family estate. In so doing, they put up their lives to auction and seal the fate of the beloved orchard.

Set at the very start of the twentieth century, The Cherry Orchard captures a poignant moment in Russia’s history as the country rolls inexorably towards 1917. This spirited new version of Chekhov’s last play follows Andrew Upton’s acclaimed adaptations of Philistines and The White Guard.

 

After a quick bite at Panera, we'll go to the theater at 6:30 to be sure to get decent seats.

 

Hope to see you there!

Lisa
item.how_to_find_us: I'll be at the Panera Bread across from the theater with a Meetup sign.
item.name: National Theatre Live - The Cherry Orchard
